Yesterday's results show that, together, we have work to do.

Dear ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

Alabama voted and Doug Jones won. Yesterday's election was a hard-fought battle that should serve as evidence that participating in our democracy is more important than ever. Your voice matters, and with your help, we can make Alabama a more just and equitable place for everyone.

This election is over, but the fight for freedom, justice, and equality continues. Join us.

We will be in the statehouse when Alabama's legislative session starts on Tuesday, January 9, advocating for policies that will advance your civil liberties in Alabama, and opposing policies that would restrict your freedom. We will be in the courthouses when we have to stand up to unconstitutional laws that infringe on your individual rights. And we will be in the streets to speak out on the matters that are important to us all.

Join. Volunteer. Connect.

With your support, we will continue to work towards turning the promises of the Bill of Rights into a reality for every Alabamian.

Thank you,

Randall Marshall
Executive Director
